sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

sense.def: be told as a reliable truth; hear about (something); have been told about; learn (from an authoritative source) as true; learn about (a battle or war etc., or a doctrine); later, XUN 1: come to hear, simply acoustically, without connotations of understanding and learning; hear that (something either true or false) CHECK ATTRIBUTIONS!

seg.line: 一時，佛住王舍城耆闍崛山中，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 一時，佛住王舍城耆闍崛山中，
一時，佛住王舍城耆闍崛山中，

sense.def: Buddhist, idiomatic: at a certain time in the past ("once upon a time" would imply that fictitiousness is implied and acknowledged. Whether it is remains a subtle open isue. The fictitiousness is in any case not openly acknowledged.)

seg.line: 與大比丘眾萬二千人俱，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 與大比丘眾萬二千人俱，

sense.def: measure-word for humans 生子二人
all the various Ns, (after negations etc.) any of various Ns
defilement; impurities> impure biases of attitude
having V-ed; marker of the past, pidgin English: already; modern Chinese: 早已經
lack any further objects (which there were before?)

BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa
emphatic or contrastive form of 其； (often but not always contrastive:) one's his/her/its own N; all of one's own (and special)
assets; what is profitable, what profits; what is in one's interest, benefit; objective interest; what one can aim for as profit
in one's mind; in one's heart
to exist in the world in a natural way > be unrestrained; be natural; follow one's natural inclinations

tls:text.tls:line: There were also two thousand persons, some of whom were still learning and some who had completed their learning.

sense.def: those who still have something to learn (but have advanced in wisdom)

tls:text.tls:line: There were also two thousand persons, some of whom were still learning and some who had completed their learning.

sense.def: those who have achieved perfect Buddhist wisdom and have nothing further to learn

tls:text.tls:line: There were also two thousand persons, some of whom were still learning and some who had completed their learning.

sense.def: measure-word for humans 生子二人

seg.line: 摩訶波闍波提比丘尼，與眷屬六千人俱。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 摩訶波闍波提比丘尼，與眷屬六千人俱。
tls:text.tls:line: There was the nun Mahaprajapati with her six thousand followers.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 摩訶波闍波提比丘尼，與眷屬六千人俱。
tls:text.tls:line: There was the nun Mahaprajapati with her six thousand followers.

sense.def: BUDDH: family members > disciples of the Buddha, assembly of monks/nuns

tls:text.tls:line: with her followers.

sense.def: BUDDH: family members > disciples of the Buddha, assembly of monks/nuns

tls:text.tls:line: There were bodhisattvas and mahasattvas, eighty thousand of them,

sense.def: measure-word for humans 生子二人

tls:text.tls:line: They had made offerings to immeasurable hundreds and thousands of Buddhas,
They had made offerings to immeasurable hundreds and thousands of Buddhas,
They had made offerings to immeasurable hundreds and thousands of Buddhas,

sense.def: plural marker used before counted or quantified noun

tls:text.tls:line: had been constantly praised by the Buddhas,

sense.def: praise a contextually determinate object N from all one's heart, praise in an innerly manner

tls:text.tls:line: had trained themselves in compassion,
had trained themselves in compassion,

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:text.tls:line: and had fully penetrated the great wisdom
and reached the farther shore.

sense.def: BUDDH: the other shore, further shore (metaphor for nirvāṇa 涅槃); SANSKRIT pāra

tls:text.tls:line: Their fame had spread throughout immeasurable worlds
Their fame had spread throughout immeasurable worlds
Their fame had spread throughout immeasurable worlds
and they were able to save countless hundreds of thousands of living beings.

sense.def: cause to obtain salvation, lead to salvation

tls:text.tls:line: and they were able to save countless hundreds of thousands of living beings.

seg.line: 爾時釋提桓因，與其眷屬二萬天子俱。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時釋提桓因，與其眷屬二萬天子俱。
tls:text.tls:line: At that time Shakra Devanam Indra with his followers, twenty thousand sons of gods, also attended.
and Great Freedom and their followers,

sense.def: BUDDH: Buddhist god, corrsponding to Śiva (the chief god of Hinduism; see also 摩醯首羅); SANSKRIT Maheśvara; PALI Mahissara

tls:text.tls:line: each with several hundreds of thousands of followers.

sense.def: BUDDH: family members > disciples of the Buddha, assembly of monks/nuns

tls:text.tls:line: each with several hundreds of thousands of followers.

sense.def: associate with; be together with, be in the company of

tls:text.tls:line: each with several hundreds of thousands of followers.
each with several hundreds of thousands of followers.

sense.def: BUDDH: family members > disciples of the Buddha, assembly of monks/nuns

tls:text.tls:line: each with several hundreds of thousands of followers.

sense.def: associate with; be together with, be in the company of

tls:text.tls:line: Each of these, after bowing in obeisance before the Buddha's feet, withdrew and took a seat to one side.

sense.def: show proper politeness towards; greet; pay obeissance to (person or body-parts)

tls:text.tls:line: Each of these, after bowing in obeisance before the Buddha's feet, withdrew and took a seat to one side.
At that time the World-Honored One,
At that time the World-Honored One,

sense.def: BUDDH: World-honoured One, i.e. the Buddha

tls:text.tls:line: surrounded by the four kinds of believers,

sense.def: BUDDH: the fourfold assembly, including monks (比丘), nuns (比丘尼), laymen (優婆塞), and laywomen (優婆夷); skr. catuṣ-pariṣad; pali catu-parisā

tls:text.tls:line: surrounded by the four kinds of believers,
received offerings and tokens of respect

sense.def: worship or show one's extreme respect for the contextually determinate N (typically with presents etc)

tls:text.tls:line: received offerings and tokens of respect

sense.def: show religious respect for, worship the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: and was honored and praised.
and was honored and praised.

sense.def: praise profusely the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: one that is guarded and kept in mind by the Buddhas.

sense.def: BUDDH: protect and reflect on > be concerned with (this word is only used in the Buddhist context and is sometimes interpreted as protecting something from external evil influences and internally being concerned with the development of something good; PLATFORM: 汝為第六代祖，善自護念，廣度有情，流布將來，無令斷絕。

tls:text.tls:line: he sat with his legs crossed in lotus position

seg.line: 入於無量 義處三昧。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 入於無量 義處三昧。
tls:text.tls:line: and entered into the samadhi of the place of immeasurable meanings,

sense.def: objective main idea; 本義 "basic intended objective meaning"; objective meaning

tls:text.tls:srcline: 入於無量 義處三昧。
tls:text.tls:line: and entered into the samadhi of the place of immeasurable meanings,

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. samādhi; state of meditative absorption

seg.line: 是時天雨 曼陀羅華。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是時天雨 曼陀羅華。
tls:text.tls:line: At that time heaven rained down mandarava flowers,

sense.def: it rains (e.g. locusts, snow, also: water)

tls:text.tls:line: filled with joy, pressed their palms together and gazed at the Buddha with a single mind.

sense.def: (cause to become a unit >) to unite (e.g. the empire); unify (people's outlooks), cause to (continue to be) unified

tls:text.tls:line: and could hear the sutra teachings which those Buddhas were expounding.
At that time the Bodhisattva Maitreya had this thought:
At that time the Bodhisattva Maitreya had this thought:
At that time the Bodhisattva Maitreya had this thought:

sense.def: thought (can be counted and specified! 是念, 一念, etc.), thinking, thought process In BUDDH. texts occasionally used negatively since it refers to the discursive and discriminating mental activities of the mind

tls:text.tls:line: Now the World-Honored One has manifested these miraculous signs.
Now the World-Honored One has manifested these miraculous signs.

sense.def: At the time N 昔者，古者

tls:text.tls:line: Now the World-Honored One has manifested these miraculous signs.

sense.def: make visible, show openly; make a show of; cause to appear; show, display (abilities);

tls:text.tls:line: Now the World-Honored One has manifested these miraculous signs.

sense.def: effect a change on something from a original state, typically, but not always, from a commendable, constant or ordinary state

tls:text.tls:line: Now the World-Honored One has manifested these miraculous signs.

sense.def: BUDDH: characteristic; mark; distinguishing feature; sometimes trans. skr. lakṣana

tls:text.tls:line: But what is the cause of these auspicious portents?
Now the Buddha, the World Honored One, has entered into samadhi.
Now the Buddha, the World Honored One, has entered into samadhi.

sense.def: enter or join an abstract body/state or association

tls:text.tls:line: Now the Buddha, the World Honored One, has entered into samadhi.

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. samādhi; state of meditative absorption

tls:text.tls:line: An unfathomable event such as this is seldom to be met with.
An unfathomable event such as this is seldom to be met with.

sense.def: become visible, appear, come to light; show one's face

tls:text.tls:line: An unfathomable event such as this is seldom to be met with.

sense.def: rare (event); rare and precious (thing) 甚稀有

tls:text.tls:line: Whom shall I question about this?

sense.def: should appropriately; be due to, be supposed to; be bound to; must; HANSHU 65: ought to (be caned); deserve to; shouldNOTE THAT MANY OF THESE ATTRIBUTIONS HAVE TO BE MOVED TO vt[0]+V[0]

tls:text.tls:line: Who can give me an answer?

sense.def: give an immediate (typically frank) reply to (in speech or in writing); respond spontaneously to

tls:text.tls:line: And again he had this thought:
And again he had this thought:
Surely he must see these rare signs.
Surely he must see these rare signs.

sense.def: rare (event); rare and precious (thing) 甚稀有

tls:text.tls:line: I will now question him.

sense.def: be about to, be going to (sometimes close to DESIRE)

seg.line: 爾時比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及諸天、龍、鬼神等，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及諸天、龍、鬼神等，
tls:text.tls:line: At this time the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen,as well as the heavenly beings, dragons, spirits, and the others all had this thought:

sense.def: BUDDH: male lay followers of the way of the Buddha

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及諸天、龍、鬼神等，
tls:text.tls:line: At this time the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen,as well as the heavenly beings, dragons, spirits, and the others all had this thought:

sense.def: BUDDH: a female follower of the way of the Buddha

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及諸天、龍、鬼神等，
tls:text.tls:line: At this time the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen,as well as the heavenly beings, dragons, spirits, and the others all had this thought:

sense.def: BUDDH: heavenly beings and dragon spirits (demons) (which were often among the audience of the sermons of the Buddha; see 天龍八部)

seg.line: 爾時彌勒菩薩，欲自決疑，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時彌勒菩薩，欲自決疑，
tls:text.tls:line: At that time Bodhisattva Maitreya wished to settle his doubts concerning the matter.

sense.def: reach a conclusion on, reach a legal decision on[decide on; determine]

tls:text.tls:srcline: 爾時彌勒菩薩，欲自決疑，
tls:text.tls:line: At that time Bodhisattva Maitreya wished to settle his doubts concerning the matter.
asked the question in verse form:

sense.def: BUDDH: Buddhist verses, poem (the third category in the twelve-fold division of the Buddhist scritpures; also referred to as qiétuó 伽陀, fèngsòng 風頌, gūqǐsòng 孤起頌; usually used for poetically summing up the contents of a preceding narrative passage); skr. ghātā

seg.line: 栴檀香風， 悅可眾心？

tls:text.tls:srcline: 栴檀香風， 悅可眾心？
tls:text.tls:line: and breezes scented with sandalwood delight the hearts of the assembly?

sense.def: give satisfaction to, cause to be satisfied

tls:text.tls:line: they rejoice in body and mind,
having gained what they never had before.

sense.def: what one has never had before: the unprecedented

tls:text.tls:line: those sage lords, lions,
expounding and preaching sutras
expounding and preaching sutras
that are subtle, wonderful and foremost.
Their voices are clear and pure,

sense.def: BUDDH ??be morally pure; skr. vyavadāna; pali vodāna

tls:text.tls:line: issuing in soft and gentle sounds,
Their Brahma sounds are profound and wonderful,
Each in his own world

seg.line: 講說正法， 種種因緣。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 講說正法， 種種因緣。
tls:text.tls:line: preaches the correct Law, following various causes and conditions

tls:text.tls:srcline: 講說正法， 種種因緣。
tls:text.tls:line: preaches the correct Law, following various causes and conditions

tls:text.tls:srcline: 講說正法， 種種因緣。
tls:text.tls:line: preaches the correct Law, following various causes and conditions

tls:text.tls:srcline: 講說正法， 種種因緣。
tls:text.tls:line: preaches the correct Law, following various causes and conditions

sense.def: BUDDH: primary and subsidiary causes> cause, reason (determining one's life etc); causal link

tls:text.tls:line: guiding living beings to enlightenment.

seg.line: 若人遭苦， 厭老病死，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 若人遭苦， 厭老病死，
tls:text.tls:line: If a person should encounter troubles, loathing old age, sickness and death,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 若人遭苦， 厭老病死，
tls:text.tls:line: If a person should encounter troubles, loathing old age, sickness and death,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 若人遭苦， 厭老病死，
tls:text.tls:line: If a person should encounter troubles, loathing old age, sickness and death,

sense.def: get fed up, get tired of a contextually determinate thing

tls:text.tls:srcline: 若人遭苦， 厭老病死，
tls:text.tls:line: If a person should encounter troubles, loathing old age, sickness and death,

seg.line: 為說涅槃， 盡諸苦際。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 為說涅槃， 盡諸苦際。
tls:text.tls:line: the Buddhas preach to him on nirvana, explaining how he may put an end to all troubles. (how N puts a complete end to... CH)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 為說涅槃， 盡諸苦際。
tls:text.tls:line: the Buddhas preach to him on nirvana, explaining how he may put an end to all troubles. (how N puts a complete end to... CH)

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. nirvāṇa (tranquility; the cessation of suffering)

tls:text.tls:line: If a person should have good fortune,

sense.def: BUDDH: meritorious practice deserving of future good fortune > merit Skt puṇya

tls:text.tls:line: having in the past made offerings to the Buddhas,
determined to seek a superior Law,
determined to seek a superior Law,
the Buddhas preach the way of the pratyekabuddha.
who carry out various religious practices,

sense.def: sundry; all kinds of, various, many, all sorts of

tls:text.tls:line: seeking to attain the unsurpassed wisdom,
seeking to attain the unsurpassed wisdom,

sense.def: an ability to engage in profound and thorough reflection; discursive cleverness; BUDDH: the highest form of religious consciousness and insight, and one of the perfections of the Boddhisattva. Sanskrit prajñā.

tls:text.tls:line: the Buddhas preach the way of purity.
Manjushri,
I will now speak of them in brief.
I will now speak of them in brief.

sense.def: expound the contextually determinate matter N

tls:text.tls:line: bodhisattvas numerous as Ganges sands,

sense.def: BUDDH: sand of the Ganges river > as numerous as the sand of the Ganges> countless

tls:text.tls:line: Some of them give alms,
gold, silver, coral,
seashell, agate,
that is foremost in the threefold world

sense.def: BUDDH: the Triple-world > comprising the three worlds of existence (欲界 'world of desire'; 色界 'world of form'; 無色界 'world of formlessness'); skr. trayo dhātavaḥ, tri-dhātu; pali tisso dhātuyo

tls:text.tls:line: that is foremost in the threefold world

sense.def: be of the first order, be excellent

tls:text.tls:line: and praised by the Buddhas.
There are some bodhisattvas
with railings and flowered canopies

sense.def: beautifully patterned; beautifully adorned with flower patterns

tls:text.tls:line: with railings and flowered canopies

sense.def: baldachin of a carriage; chariot canopy; umbrella

tls:text.tls:line: adorning their top and sides.
or their wives and children,
seeking the unsurpassed way.

seg.line: 頭目身體， 欣樂施與，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 頭目身體， 欣樂施與，
tls:text.tls:line: who happily give heads, eyes, bodies and limbs

tls:text.tls:srcline: 頭目身體， 欣樂施與，
tls:text.tls:line: who happily give heads, eyes, bodies and limbs

tls:text.tls:srcline: 頭目身體， 欣樂施與，
tls:text.tls:line: who happily give heads, eyes, bodies and limbs
in their search for the Buddha wisdom.

sense.def: wisdom BUDDH: (perfection of) wisdom (one of the Six Perfections of a Bodhisattva, liùdù 六度, see also bānrěbōluómì 般若波羅蜜); skr. prajñā-pāramitā

tls:text.tls:line: Manjushri,

seg.line: 我見諸王， 往詣佛所，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 我見諸王， 往詣佛所，
tls:text.tls:line: I see kings going to visit the place of the Buddha

sense.def: go to, betake one to (a place)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 我見諸王， 往詣佛所，
tls:text.tls:line: I see kings going to visit the place of the Buddha

sense.def: the place where N is (and belongs) (cf. modern Chinese 他那邊兒)

tls:text.tls:line: to ask him about the unsurpassed way.

seg.line: 便捨樂土、 宮殿臣妾，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 便捨樂土、 宮殿臣妾，
tls:text.tls:line: They put aside their happy lands, their palaces, their men and women attendants,

sense.def: discard, get rid of (with abstract N)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 便捨樂土、 宮殿臣妾，
tls:text.tls:line: They put aside their happy lands, their palaces, their men and women attendants,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 便捨樂土、 宮殿臣妾，
tls:text.tls:line: They put aside their happy lands, their palaces, their men and women attendants,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 便捨樂土、 宮殿臣妾，
tls:text.tls:line: They put aside their happy lands, their palaces, their men and women attendants,
shave their hair and beard
shave their hair and beard
and don the clothes of the Dharma.

sense.def: read pī: wear (cloth); bear (shield etc); abstractly, occasionally: bear (a bad name etc)

tls:text.tls:line: and don the clothes of the Dharma.

seg.line: 或見菩薩， 而作比丘，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 或見菩薩， 而作比丘，
tls:text.tls:line: Or I see bodhisattvas who become monks,

sense.def: become, turn into; turn oneself into

tls:text.tls:line: living alone in quietude,
delighting in chanting the sutras.
delighting in chanting the sutras.

sense.def: intone formally (poetry, not necessarily by heart: HANSHU 62 p. 2714-5); recite emphatically (distinguished prose); preach

tls:text.tls:line: delighting in chanting the sutras.

seg.line: 又見菩薩， 勇猛精進，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 又見菩薩， 勇猛精進，
tls:text.tls:line: Again I see bodhisattvas bravely and vigorously exerting themselves,

sense.def: (BUDDH:) (description of Buddhist practice:) bravely and fiercly > energetically, with all one's might, powerfully, heroicly (this word has an exremely high frequency in Buddhist translations, describing one of the characterstics of a Bodhisattva); skr. vikrānta (also: yǒngjiàn 勇建, mèngjiàn 猛建)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 又見菩薩， 勇猛精進，
tls:text.tls:line: Again I see bodhisattvas bravely and vigorously exerting themselves,

sense.def: BUDDH: put in effort in order to make spiritual progress

tls:text.tls:srcline: 又見菩薩， 勇猛精進，
tls:text.tls:line: Again I see bodhisattvas bravely and vigorously exerting themselves,
entering the deep mountains,

sense.def: enter (as ruler); enter as a visitor; enter into (so as to take control of or so as to get stuck in, or so as to find refuge in); enter through

tls:text.tls:line: entering the deep mountains,
their thoughts on the Buddha way.

sense.def: BUDDH: think; think of (this word is extremely frequent in Buddhist texts, in Taisho more the 7,000 occurrences!)sometimes used in the BUDDH. context more technically: to think and judge on concrete sense data one has perceived; to concentrate on certain thoughts in meditation T.3/186: 503a7 一心專精思惟正義 to reflect about the right meaning with great concentration

tls:text.tls:line: And I see them removing themselves from desire,

sense.def: detach oneself from; distance oneself from, become separated from; deviate from; be apart from; leave the realm of so as to transcend; transcend; become detached from

tls:text.tls:line: And I see them removing themselves from desire,
And I see them removing themselves from desire,
advancing deep into the practice of mediation
advancing deep into the practice of mediation

sense.def: cultivate (one's person, the ancients etc); apply oneself to; train and exercise (troops); occasionally also with negative objects: LH 2 修詐 "cultivate fraudulence"

tls:text.tls:line: advancing deep into the practice of mediation

sense.def: BUDDH: meditation and concentration, samādhi achieved during meditation, the combined practice of (analytical) mediation and concentration; generally: meditative practice (sometimes also specifically referring to the Fifth Perfection of Bodhisattva, see liùdù 六度; skr. dhyāna-pāramitā 'Perfection of Concentration/Meditation; see also 禪波羅蜜)

tls:text.tls:line: resting in meditation, palms pressed together,
resting in meditation, palms pressed together,

sense.def: bring one's palms together before the upper part of one's chest as a polite way of greeting someone one respects

tls:text.tls:line: praising the king of the doctrines.

sense.def: LIJI 5.4f: appraise positively and recommend LSCQ 贊能

tls:text.tls:line: profound in wisdom, firm in purpose,

sense.def: be firm, be self-assured and unwobbling 甚固

tls:text.tls:line: and accept and abide by all they hear.

sense.def: what one hears from authority> what one learns

tls:text.tls:line: and accept and abide by all they hear.

sense.def: receive so as to hold; receive and firmly retain

tls:text.tls:line: proficient in both meditation and wisdom,

sense.def: BUDDH. concentration; this is the a translation of skr. samādhi; syn. to the phonetical transcription 三昧

tls:text.tls:line: proficient in both meditation and wisdom,

sense.def: an ability to engage in profound and thorough reflection; discursive cleverness; BUDDH: the highest form of religious consciousness and insight, and one of the perfections of the Boddhisattva. Sanskrit prajñā.

tls:text.tls:line: proficient in both meditation and wisdom,

sense.def: be completely present; be completely taken care of/respected; be amply present, be sufficiently provided; be completely present (typically of good qualities; often referring to inherently existing features) > be perfect; be in perfectly good shape[CA]

tls:text.tls:line: who use immeasurable numbers of similes
who use immeasurable numbers of similes
to expound the Law to the assembly,

sense.def: expound the way of the Buddha

tls:text.tls:line: delighting in preaching the Law,
delighting in preaching the Law,
defeating the legions of the devil

sense.def: HF 1.2.57: rout (the enemy one faces), smash the opponent

tls:text.tls:line: defeating the legions of the devil
and beating the Dharma drum.

sense.def: knock against (mostly drums but also bells) so as to produce a sound; knock (at a gate)

tls:text.tls:line: and beating the Dharma drum.
profoundly still and silent,

sense.def: be peaceful, be in a state of tranquillity

tls:text.tls:line: profoundly still and silent,

sense.def: have a good time; be quietlly at one's ease

tls:text.tls:line: honored by heavenly beings and dragons

sense.def: show religious respect for, worship the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: no flaw in their conduct,

sense.def: ZUO: proper behaviour; BUDDH: the proper behaviour/right demeanor; in the Buddhist context referring to the proper conduct of monks and nuns as defined in the vinaya texts and other texts related to the precepts (the origin of this term is pre-Buddhist and refers to right behaviour, proper demeanor; in the Buddhist context referring to the proper conduct of monks and nuns which is defined especially in vinaya texts and texts related to the precepts. Often the term refers to four specific deportments in daily life (sìwēiyí 四威儀), i.e. when walking, standing, sitting, and lying down (representing the daily activities). See especially DDB (see also NAKAMURA: 33b; FOGUANG: 3771; according to Yanagida yǒubiǎo 有表 'have-expression > expressed, manifest' is a term typically used in the Vinaya School, referring to the concrete correct behaviour required in performing the 'three actions' (sānyè 三業, i.e. physical actions, oral expressions and thought processes). Often set in contrast to wúbiǎo jiè 無表戒 'un-expressed (non-manifest) precepts' (see YANAGIDA 1990: 396, fn. 269; on yǒubiǎo and wúbiǎo see also DDB) corr[CH]
